media:group.media:title: ิปีถีนีบีฅีฝ ีฅีถ ีบีกีฟีชีธึีด ีฅึีฅีญีกีถีฅึีซีถ ีฟีกึีขีฅึ ีฅึีฏึีถีฅึีธึีด. ิฟึีฉีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฟีกีบีกีถ

2020-ีซ ีฐีกีต-ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีทึีดีกีถ ีฃีฎีซ ีีกีพีธึีท-ินีธีพีธึีฆ ีฐีกีฟีพีกีฎีซ ีผีกีฆีดีกีฏีกีถ ีขีกีญีธึีดีถีฅึีซึ ีนีธึีฝ ีฟีกึีซ ีกีถึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฐีตีธึีฝีซีฝีกึึีฅีฌีตีกีถ ีฐีกีฟีพีกีฎีธึีด ีฏึีฏีซีถ ีฟีกีฃีถีกีบีกีตีซีถ ีฟึีกีดีกีคึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ ีฅีถ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีฐีถีกึีกีพีธึ ีธีฟีถีฑีฃีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีทีธึึีปึ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีจ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซึ ีกีถีฐีกีบีกีฒ ีนีธึีฝ ีฃีตีธึีฒ ีง ีบีกีฐีกีถีปีธึีด, ีดีซีถีนีคีฅีผ ีฐีกีตีฏีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีฒีดีซ ีบีกีฐีกีถีปีถีฅึีจี ีี 31 ีฃีตีธึีฒีฅึีซ ีฐีธีฒีกีฟีกึีกีฎึีถีฅึีซ ีพีฅึีกีคีกึีฑีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ, ีดีถีธึีด ีฅีถ ีกีถีฟีฅีฝีพีกีฎึ ีีกึีฟีซ 12-ีซีถ ีฐึีกีพีซึีกีฎ ีกีฝีธึีฌีซีฝีซีถ ีพีกึีนีกีบีฅีฟ ีีซีฏีธีฌ ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีจ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีฅึ, ีธึ ีี ีฟีกึีกีฎึีจ 29 743 ึีกีผีกีฏีธึีฝีซ ีฏีด ีงึ

entry.title: Bridging Continents: Expanding Europe-Asia Defense Cooperation

media:group.media:title: Bridging Continents: Expanding Europe-Asia Defense Cooperation
media:group.media:description:
In this discussion, military expert Leonid Nersisyan joins Patrick Elliott to analyze key developments in Armenia's strategic partnerships and defense procurements, including the expanding cooperation with France and potential additions like India and Greece. They explore the country's efforts to strengthen its armed forces through collaborative and balanced multilateral relationships, and speculate on what emerging configurations may signify for regional stability.

ิตึึีกีถีซ ีกีพีกีฃีกีถีซีถ ีดีกึีฟีซ 12-ีซ ีถีซีฝีฟีซีถ ีจีถีคีธึีถีฅึ ีฐีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีฟึีกีถีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีธึีฒีฅีพีกึีฑีซ ีขีกึีฑึีกึีดีกีถ ีถีกีญีกีฃีซีฎีจึ ิฑีตีถ ีธึีชีซ ีดีฅีป ีฏีดีฟีถีซ 2024-ีซ ีฝีฅีบีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 1-ีซีถ: ีีธึีซีกีฌีกีฏีกีถ ีธึีธีท ีญีดีขีฅึีซ, ึ ึีซีถีกีฏี ีธึีฝีกีถีธีฒีถีฅึีซ, ีฉีธีทีกีฏีกีผีธึีถีฅึีซ, ีฝีธึีซีกีฌีกีฏีกีถ ึ ีฐีกีฟีธึีฏ ีญีดีขีฅึีซ ีฐีกีดีกึ ีฏีฃีธึีฎีฅีถ ีกึีฟีธีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ึีกีฉีฅีฉีถีฅึึ ีีกีฉีฅีฉีถีฅึีจ ีคีฅีผ ีนีฅีถ ีดีทีกีฏีพีฅีฌึ ิธีฝีฟ ึีกีฒีกึีกีตีซีถ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถี ีกึีฟีธีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ีฏีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีพีฅีถ ีดีซีถีนึ ีฝีฅีบีฟีฅีดีขีฅึึ

entry.title: Armenia will leave Russian military bloc if concerns not addressed, says Pashinyan

media:group.media:title: Armenia will leave Russian military bloc if concerns not addressed, says Pashinyan
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armenia will leave the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a Russian-led military alliance, if it does not address the countryโs concerns, Nikol Pashinyan said. ๐ The prime minister said he will never cede control of any territories located within Soviet Armeniaโs borders, while leaving the possibility open he may hand over eight villages that belonged to Soviet Azerbaijan but are now under Armeniaโs control. ๐ Armenia is working โdailyโ to secure the release of the dozens of Armenians currently held in Azerbaijan, according to Pashinyan, who did not provide additional detail. ๐ The prime minister indicated the government will continue financial support for the more than 100,000 Armenians who were forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh last year. ๐ Pashinyan said he felt โembitteredโ after CivilNet revealed serious irregularities in campaign donations accepted by his party, but insisted nothing illegal had taken place.

entry.title: Germany's growing role in the Armenia-Azerbaijan conflict

media:group.media:title: Germany's growing role in the Armenia-Azerbaijan conflict
media:group.media:description:
In this discussion, regional expert Stefan Meister analyzes the backlash in Berlin faced by panelists discussing Armenian cultural heritage in Artsakh, and Germany's expanding mediation role. CivilNet host Patrick Elliott and Meister explore Germanyโs historical role in the region. They discuss the ways Armenia may cooperate more closely with the EU and the West.
